timeSeriesQuery.timeSeriesQueryLanguage:
fetch k8s_container
| metric 'kubernetes.io/container/cpu/core_usage_time'
    | ${project_id}
    | ${location}
    | ${cluster_name}
| filter resource.namespace_name !~ '(kube|istio|gatekeeper|gke|gmp|gke-gmp)-system|gke-managed-filestorecsi|gke-mcs'
| align rate(5m)
| every 5m
| group_by
    [resource.project_id, resource.location, resource.cluster_name, resource.namespace_name, metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_name, metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_type, resource.container_name],.max
| filter value_core_usage_time_max > 0
| row_count

fetch k8s_container
| metric 'kubernetes.io/container/memory/request_bytes'
| ${project_id}
| ${location}
| ${cluster_name}
| filter
    resource.namespace_name !~ '(kube|istio|gatekeeper|gke|gmp|gke-gmp)-system|gke-managed-filestorecsi|gke-mcs'
| every 5m
| group_by
    [resource.project_id, resource.location, resource.cluster_name, resource.namespace_name, metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_name, metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_type, resource.container_name],.mean
| { best_effort_workloads:
      filter value_request_bytes_mean == 0
      | row_count
  ; all_workloads:
      ident 

      | row_count }
| ratio
| scale '%'

text.content: Not setting CPU or memory requests constitutes a reliability risk. When memory is unset, the kubelet can stop your pods anytime and mark them as failed. When CPU is unset, your Pods' CPU can be throttled to 0, causing your workloads to become unresponsive. [Set appropriate resource requests and limits](https://cloud.google.com/architecture/best-practices-for-running-cost-effective-kubernetes-applications-on-gke#set_appropriate_resource_requests_and_limits)

Pods using more memory than requested constitute a reliability risk. Like Best Effort pods above, they can be stopped by the kubelet anytime. When workloads consume more CPU than requested, they can be throttled, slowing down the workload.
 [Set appropriate resource requests and limits](https://cloud.google.com/architecture/best-practices-for-running-cost-effective-kubernetes-applications-on-gke#set_appropriate_resource_requests_and_limits)

timeSeriesQuery.timeSeriesQueryLanguage:
fetch k8s_container
| filter (resource.namespace_name !~ '(kube|istio|gatekeeper|gke|gmp|gke-gmp)-system|gke-managed-filestorecsi|gke-mcs')
| ${project_id}
| ${location}
| ${cluster_name}
| {
  metric 'kubernetes.io/container/memory/used_bytes'
  | filter metric.memory_type == 'non-evictable'
  | every 5m
  | group_by
      [resource.project_id, resource.location, resource.cluster_name,
       resource.namespace_name,
       metadata.system.top_level_controller_name:
         metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_name,
       metadata.system.top_level_controller_type:
         metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_type],[value_used_bytes_mean_aggregate: aggregate(value.used_bytes)];
  metric 'kubernetes.io/container/memory/request_bytes'
  | every 5m
  | group_by
      [resource.project_id, resource.location, resource.cluster_name,
       resource.namespace_name,
       metadata.system.top_level_controller_name:
         metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_name,
       metadata.system.top_level_controller_type:
         metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_type],
      [value_request_bytes_mean_mean: mean(value.request_bytes)]
  | filter value_request_bytes_mean_mean == 0
} 
| join
| value [t_0.value_used_bytes_mean_aggregate]

widget.title: Workloads without memory requested - MiB used

timeSeriesQuery.timeSeriesQueryLanguage:
fetch k8s_container
| ${project_id}
| ${location}
| ${cluster_name}
| filter
    resource.namespace_name !~ '(kube|istio|gatekeeper|gke|gmp|gke-gmp)-system|gke-managed-filestorecsi|gke-mcs'
| { 
  metric 'kubernetes.io/container/cpu/request_cores'
    | every 5m
    | group_by
        [resource.project_id, resource.location, resource.cluster_name,
         resource.namespace_name,
         metadata.system.top_level_controller_name:
           metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_name,
         metadata.system.top_level_controller_type:
           metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_type],
        [value_request_bytes_mean_mean: mean(value.request_cores)]
    | filter value_request_bytes_mean_mean == 0 ;
    metric 'kubernetes.io/container/cpu/core_usage_time'
| align rate(5m)
| every 5m
    | group_by
        [resource.project_id, resource.location, resource.cluster_name,
         resource.namespace_name,
         metadata.system.top_level_controller_name:
           metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_name,
         metadata.system.top_level_controller_type:
           metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_type], [value_core_usage_time_aggregate: aggregate(value.core_usage_time)]}
| join
| value [mul(t_1.value_core_usage_time_aggregate,1000)]

widget.title: Workloads without CPU requested - mCPU used

timeSeriesQuery.timeSeriesQueryLanguage:
fetch k8s_container
| metric 'kubernetes.io/container/cpu/request_utilization'
    | ${project_id}
    | ${location}
    | ${cluster_name}
| filter resource.namespace_name !~ '(kube|istio|gatekeeper|gke|gmp|gke-gmp)-system|gke-managed-filestorecsi|gke-mcs'
| every 5m
| group_by
    [resource.project_id, resource.location, resource.cluster_name,
     resource.namespace_name,
     metadata.system.top_level_controller_name:
       metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_name],
    [value_request_utilization_mean:
       mean(value.request_utilization)]
| filter value_request_utilization_mean >= 1
| scale '%'

widget.title: Workloads using more CPU than requested - CPU utilization

timeSeriesQuery.timeSeriesQueryLanguage:
fetch k8s_container
| metric 'kubernetes.io/container/memory/request_utilization'
    | ${project_id}
    | ${location}
    | ${cluster_name}
| filter
    (resource.namespace_name !~ '(kube|istio|gatekeeper|gke|gmp|gke-gmp)-system|gke-managed-filestorecsi|gke-mcs'
     && metric.memory_type == 'non-evictable')
| every 5m
| group_by
    [resource.project_id, resource.location, resource.cluster_name,
     resource.namespace_name, metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_name,
     metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_type],
    [value_request_utilization_mean: mean(value.request_utilization)]
| filter val() >= 1
| scale '%'

widget.title: Workloads using more memory than requested - memory utilization
Memory request MiB recommended per replica

timeSeriesQuery.timeSeriesQueryLanguage:
fetch k8s_scale
| metric
    'kubernetes.io/autoscaler/container/cpu/per_replica_recommended_request_cores'
    | filter resource.namespace_name !~ '(kube|istio|gatekeeper|gke|gmp|gke-gmp)-system|gke-managed-filestorecsi|gke-mcs'
    | ${project_id}
    | ${location}
    | ${cluster_name}
| group_by 14d,
    [value_per_replica_recommended_request_cores_mean:
       max(value.per_replica_recommended_request_cores)]
| mul 1000

widget.title: CPU request mCore recommended per replica

text.content:
Refer to the following recommended resource requests for CPU and memory requirements that ensuring efficient resource allocation based on VPA recommendations. They are calculated as 14 day peak recommendations.
**Want to see workload recommendations at scale?**
[Right-size your GKE workloads](https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/containers-kubernetes/optimize-gke-workloads-at-scale)
